author: craigmcc
msg: Add docs for <Engine> element, and tweak the existing ones slightly.

author: craigmcc
msg: Change the way that Jasper looks for the "?jsp_precompile" precompilation
request parameter.  Previously, it was using request.getParameter(), which
caused all of the request parameters to be parsed before the JSP page
would have the opportunity to call request.setCharacterEncoding().

author: craigmcc
msg: In the continuing saga of getting race conditions on invoked servlets
fixed, add a check for a pre-existing Wrapper for the servlet by *name* as
well as by *class*.  Much thanks to Eddie Ruvinsky for digging in to the
code and helping figure out what's going on here.
PR: Bugzilla #3188
Submitted by:	Eddie Ruvinsky <ruvinsky@yahoo.com>

author: craigmcc
msg: Add a replacement for the java.net.URL class that does the parsing and
relative-URL resolution performed by java.net.URL, but does not suffer
from the limitation that it only supports protocols for which a
URLStreamHandler is installed.  In particular, this was preventing a
Tomcat 4 install from successfully performing a response.sendRedirect() to
an SSL-enabled URL, unless the redirecting Tomcat itself had JSSE
installed.
Also added extensives JUnit tests to ensure that parsing and relative
resolution works as much as possible like java.net.URL does it.  There are
three cases where the answers are different, that are commented out.
These are really edge cases that won't matter in real life, but they
should eventually be corrected.
NOTE:  The parsing and path normalization code is horrendously inefficient
at the moment.  I focused first on getting the behavior right, and
creating a bunch of unit tests so that we can make sure we don't introduce
regressions as the string processing is optimized.
PR: Bugzilla #3139
Submitted by:	Shawn Bayern <bayern@essentially.net>

author: craigmcc
msg: Make it possible to start Catalina under a JPDA debugging environment.  If
you execute
$CATALINA_HOME/bin/catalina.sh jpda start
the options in the JPDA_OPTS environment variable are added to those
specified by CATALINA_OPTS to enable debugging.  A convenient default
value for JPDA_OPTS is made available if you do not specify it.
Submitted by:  Henning P. Schmiedehausen <mailgate@hometree.net>,
Jon Stevens <jon@latchkey.com>
